items.title: Safe / Safety
items.comment: '安全' (ānquán) means 'safe' or 'safety'. It can describe a secure situation or condition.

items.title: Woman
items.comment: '女人' (nǚrén) means 'woman' or 'female'. The character '女' (nǚ) represents femininity.

items.title: Man / Men
items.comment: '男人' (nánrén) means 'man' or 'men'. The character '男' (nán) represents masculinity.

items.title: Hand
items.comment: '手' (shǒu) means 'hand'. It is commonly used in words related to manual actions or skills.

items.title: Secret
items.comment: '秘密' (mìmì) means 'secret'. It can refer to confidential information or something hidden.

items.title: Eye
items.comment: '眼睛' (yǎnjing) means 'eye'. The character '眼' (yǎn) refers to the eye, while '睛' (jing) specifies the eyeball.

items.title: Ear
items.comment: '耳朵' (ěrduo) means 'ear'. '耳' (ěr) is the core character for 'ear', and '朵' (duo) is a common suffix in body part names.

items.title: Foot / Feet
items.comment: '脚' (jiǎo) means 'foot' or 'feet'. It is used in words related to walking or movement.

items.title: Mouth
items.comment: '嘴' (zuǐ) means 'mouth'. It is commonly used in phrases related to speaking and eating.

items.title: Head
items.comment: '头' (tóu) means 'head'. It can also be used metaphorically, such as in '领导头' (lǐngdǎo tóu), meaning 'leader'.

items.title: Classmate
items.comment: '同学' (tóngxué) refers to a classmate, someone who studies in the same school or class.

items.title: Friend
items.comment: '朋友' (péngyǒu) means 'friend' and is commonly used to refer to close acquaintances.

items.title: Student
items.comment: '学生' (xuéshēng) means 'student', referring to someone who is studying at a school or university.

items.title: Thing
items.comment: '东西' (dōngxi) means 'thing' or 'object'. It is used to refer to physical items but not abstract concepts.

items.title: Earth
items.comment: '地球' (dìqiú) means 'Earth', referring to the planet we live on. '地' (dì) means 'ground' or 'land', and '球' (qiú) means 'sphere' or 'ball'.

items.title: Dirt / Soil
items.comment: '土' (tǔ) means 'dirt' or 'soil'. It is associated with earth, land, and agriculture.

items.title: Plant
items.comment: '植物' (zhíwù) means 'plant' or 'vegetation'. '植' (zhí) relates to planting, and '物' (wù) means 'thing' or 'object'.

items.title: Grow
items.comment: '生长' (shēngzhǎng) means 'to grow' or 'growth'. It can refer to the development of plants, animals, or people.

items.title: Few / Less
items.comment: '少' (shǎo) means 'few' or 'less'. It is used to describe a small quantity of something.

items.title: Many / More
items.comment: '多' (duō) means 'many' or 'more'. It is used to describe a large quantity of something.

items.title: Also is / Also am / Also are
items.comment: '也是' (yě shì) means 'also is', 'also am', or 'also are'. It is used to express agreement or similarity in statements.
